setting.conf_title_desc: Display settings for the (e32) ibEconomy Application

setting.conf_description: Show the ibEconomy sidebar by default?

setting.conf_title: Skins to NOT display sidebar on
setting.conf_description: Any skins that you select here will not display the ibEconomy sidebar
Speed of the marquee, if you happen to add a sidebar block with the a marquee display type
Show announcement above application on every page?
Enter announcment to display. BBCode is OK.
Select buttons to show on the top left of ibEconomy.
setting.conf_extra: don=Quick Donate bank=Open Bank Account stock=Buy Stock cc=Buy Credit Card lt=Invest loan=Apply for a Loan shopitem=Shop lottery=Lottery

setting.conf_description: If enabled, custom item images thumbs will show a bit larger (80X80)
Enable profile tab?
Turn on the below welcome message?
Enter the contents to display as the ibEconomy Frontpage.
Select which page will be first presented when visiting ibEconomy. If not set to default, make sure that page is enabled
setting.conf_extra: global.frontpage=Default global.overview=Global Overview global.portfolio=Global Assets global.transactions=Global Transactions global.settings=Settings me.my_overview=My Overview me.my_shopitems=My Shop Items me.my_banks=My Banks me.my_stocks=My Stocks me.my_ccs=My Credit me.my_lts=My Long-Term me.my_loans=My Loans me.my_welfare=My Welfare shop.all=Shop Categories shop.items=Shop Items cash.lottery=Lotteries

setting.conf_description: Show the box above the copyright that shows active users and various ibEconomy stats?
Show the various stats in the right side of the stats box? (total points, global debt, etc).
Show a formatted list of users active in ibEconomy?

setting.conf_title_desc: General settings for the (e32) ibEconomy Application

setting.conf_description: On/Off

What do you want to call ibEconomy?
To change the title of the tab on the public side, you need to edit the public name of this app directly: ACP->System->Manage Apps->ibEconomy->Edit Application Details->Application Public Title
What do you want to name the currency used in this app?
What symbol do you want to use to denote currency?
If enabled, values, costs, point totals, net worth, etc will all be formatted with a decimal, for more of a money feel
If decimal is disabled, when calculating fees and taxes, should the number be rounded down or up?

Which points system do you wish to use with ibEconomy?
(`MEMBERS` database field)
setting.conf_extra: eco_points=ibEconomy Points points=iPoints/IBstore/ibMarket/Perfect Points (`points`) ibbookie_points=ibBookie (`ibbookie_points`) money=IBProBattle (`money`) utr_points=Ultimate Referrals (`utr_points`)

setting.conf_description: Show a page that provides many global settings (which you select here) as well as a member's personal settings (max pts, can use banks, can shop, etc)?
Enter the number that will act as the global "Per Page" setting (Bank lists can have double, as there can be 2 types of banks per bank).
Enter the number of portfolio items to show per page in the ACP Manage Portfolio section of ibEconomy

When the task runs to recalculate every member's total worth, should their total welfare received also count in the figure? Leaving on No will force the system to subtract a member's welfare from their total worth.
Leave on so that you know when a new version is released just by visiting the frontpage of ibEconomy.
Input the cutoff time (in minutes) for a user to considered "active" in ibEconomy
If enabled, users will be able to choose an Amazon style 1-Click purchase instead of the conventional checkout screen
If a $29.99 license has been purchased to remove Copyright, input it here.
If off, the Cashier tab will not show, so if you have this off you better also have all investments and all shop items off too.
If off, member's portfolios (assets) will not be stored in cache. This will add a query to certain pages, but might be more efficient overall for large boards.
If off, Member Worth/Rankins won't show, only on-hand points. So banks/stocks/shop item values, etc don't get counted.

REMEMBER: shopping, banking, etc already have built-in checks. This is for random things like Points Per Rep if you have it giving negative.
In some cases (not Points Per Rep) this adds one query if enabled, so it is recommended to leave this setting off.
If ON, only members in groups with the ibEconomy Adminsistrate access (edit points) can view all transactions. All other members can only view their own.
If ON, there will be a Standings/Rankings page within the Global Economy tab and member's point rankings will be viewable on their profile.
Turn on Donations?
Allow members to post emoticons in donation comments?
Allow members to use bbcode in donation comments?
Send a PM to the donation receiver?
Enter the title of the donation PM. The same macros below also work here.
setting.conf_default: You have received a donation of <#DONATION_AMOUNT#> Points!

setting.conf_description:
Enter the contents of the donation PM. Replaceable Macros:
<#TO_NAME#> - Name of donation receiver <#MESSAGE#> - Donation reason <#DONATION_AMOUNT#> - Amount of donation <#FROM_NAME#> - Donator
Allow users to browse ALL user's transactions (donations, purchases, etc)?
Allow users to browse ALL user's assets/portfolio (banks, shop items, etc)?
Enable Points Per New Topic?
Enable Points Per Reply?
Enable Points Per Replies in One's Own Topic?
If the number of points being given is negative and the poster would go negative after posting, enable this setting to restrict the user from posting.
Factor in a member's group's "Forum Points Percentage" for the below point values?
How many points shall be awarded to to users when giving positive reputation? (leave blank/0 to disable)
How many points shall be awarded to to users when receiving positive reputation? (leave blank/0 to disable)
How many points shall be awarded to to users when giving negative reputation? (leave blank/0 to disable)
How many points shall be awarded to to users when receiving negative reputation? (leave blank/0 to disable)
Turn on the Points button beneath Posts/PMs? (better to leave the hooks enabled and use this setting instead)
Display as a button beneath post? Set to No to instead show button above in Member Pane (the default style from ibEconomy 1.0).
Show decimal and cents? (leave set to No to save valuable space
If on, owned shop items will be displayed next to posts/PMs
This is the max number of shop items that will be displayed next to posts/PMs
Items of selected types will NOT be displayed
setting.conf_extra: add_color_topic_title=Add Color Topic Title adjust_member_post_count=Adjust Member Post Count adjust_member_rep=Adjust Member Rep award_item=Award Item ban_member=Ban Member blank_unusable_item=Blank Unusable Item change_member_avatar=Change member Avatar change_member_group=Change Member Group change_member_name=Change Member Name change_member_signature=Change Member Signature change_member_skin=Change Member Skin change_member_status=Change Member Status change_member_title=Change Member Title close_topic=Close Topic open_topic=Open Topic password_to_forum=Password to Forum pin_topic=Pin Topic promote_to_vip=Promote to VIP random_points=Random Points random_shop_item=Random Shop Item scratch_off=Scratch Off secret_message=Secret Message send_pm_to_id=Send PM to ID steal_points=Steal Points steal_rep=Steal Rep unban_member=Unban Member unpin_topic=Unpin Topic upload_emoticon=Upload Emoticon

setting.conf_title_desc: Investment settings for the (e32) ibEconomy Application

setting.conf_description: Which page should be default within the investments tab?
Turn on Banks?
Enter the rate at which interest is disbursed for savings accounts. (in days)
Turn on Stocks?
Enter the percentage that will be taken from every stock purchase
Input the percentage charged for every stock sell

setting.conf_title: Low End of Share Price Adjustment Factor
setting.conf_description: The low end of the stock price adjustment range. Mostly important for "Basic" stock, which is done randomly. See the long-term setting for more description.
Enter the rate at which stock values are adjusted. (IN MINUTES, so keep it pretty high if your forum can't handle the relatively high load process throughout the day! 1440=1 Day)
Share values cannot exceed this value. Leave blank/0 to disable.

setting.conf_title: Number of Posts Required to Earn Max Value Increase
setting.conf_description: This is the number that will be used when POST based stock values are adjusted. If 25 posts per stock cycle would be a GREAT day on your board, then leave it around 25. If only a few posts per day is good, then set lower. The LOWER the number the EASIER it is to increase the value.

setting.conf_title: Number of Points Required to Earn Max Value Increase
setting.conf_description: This is the number that will be used when POINT based stock values are adjusted. Same as above, except base this on your board's points.

setting.conf_title: Number of Registrations Required to Earn Max Value Increase
setting.conf_description: This is the number that will be used when REGISTRATION based stock values are adjusted. Same as above, except base this on your board's registrations.
Turn on Credit-Cards
Enter the percentage of a credit-card's total debt that must be paid each cycle (set below).
Enter the number of days per credit-card billing cycle
Turn on Long-Term Investments?
Enter the percentage that will be taken from every long-term investment buy-in or cash-in
Input the percentage charged for every long-term cashout

setting.conf_title: Low End of Balance Adjustment Factor
setting.conf_description: The value adjustment of a long-term is done randomly. A number is picked between XX and 10. Select what XX is here. For example, selecting -10 would make the range -10 => 10, so it is equal odds that a positive number is picked as a negative number. If you were to pick 0, then EVERY adjustment would be positive.
Enter the rate at which investment balance totals are adjusted. (in days)

Select the investment types for which you wish to enable the below interest restrictions. Good so that members can't get huge interest-driven accounts and then go inactive from the forum but continue to collect interest checks. Or (in the case of APR/debt and only for the activity setting) so that members don't pile up huge sums of debt if they are absent from the forum.
Welfare has it's own settings and is not included here.
setting.conf_extra: bank=Banks cc=Credit Cards lt=Long-Term Investments loan=Loan

setting.conf_description:
Anyone below this number in PPD will NOT receive their due interest (if interest restrictions are enabled)
0 to disable

Anyone who has not signed into the forum within the last this number of days will not receive their due interest (if interest restrictions are enabled)
0 to disable
If left on, savings accounts/creditcards/long-terms, etc in user's portfolios will continue to build interest/debt EVEN if the item has been deleted from ibEconomy OR turned off.

setting.conf_title_desc: Loan settings for the (e32) ibEconomy Application

setting.conf_description: Turn on the loan component of ibEconomy?
Enter the rate at which interest on unpaid loans is collected. (in days)
Enter the collection rate at which a loan's penalty is levied on unpaid past-due loans. (in days)

setting.conf_title_desc: Shop settings for the (e32) ibEconomy Application

setting.conf_description: Turn on the Shop component of ibEconomy?
What percentage of the total cost will be charged as Sales Tax?
What percentage of the current item price should be deducted from the total returned amount when a user sells back a shop item?
Input the percentage (of the current item cost) to be charged to a user when they send an item to another user. % is deducted from on-hand points.
Allow users to send shop items in their portfolio to other users? (group settings must allow as well)
Send PM to item recipient?
Title of PM sent to item recipient

Body of PM sent to item recipient.
Macros:

<#RECIPIENT#>: Item Recipient's Name <#SENDER#>: Item Sender's Name <#ITEM#>: Item Title <#QUANTITY#>: Item Quantity

If enabled, members will be able to fully use the various shop items which decrease a value (points, posts, etc) on members who don't have enough to cover the amount being adjusted, and therefore will go negative.

If above is disabled, how do you want to handle instances where the member would go negative? Enable so that it will steal all their ____ (zero out their total). Disable to prohibit the the action from occurring at all (an error will be displayed).

Some shop items may send a PM upon use, enter the ID of the member from whom the PM will come. Remember a user cannot send themselves a PM, so the member whose ID is entered will not be able to use any shop item which sends a PM.

setting.conf_title_desc: Welfare settings for the (e32) ibEconomy Application

setting.conf_description: Turn on the welfare component of ibEconomy?
How many days between each welfare disbursement? (in days)

Leave on Yes to ALWAYS enforce the welfare restrictions below. Set to No to only enforce the restrictions during the application process but not later on (such as during each welfare check disbursement).

If a member has over this number of points, they will not qualify for welfare.
Leave at 0 to skip

If a member has over this number of points (in total worth), they will not qualify for welfare.
Leave at 0 to skip

If a member has over this number of welfare points, they will not qualify for further welfare.
Leave at 0 to skip

A member must have above this number of posts to qualify for welfare checks.
Leave at 0 to skip

A member's post per day average must be above this number to qualify for welfare.
Leave at 0 to skip

Minimum days as a member to be eligible for welfare.
Leave at 0 to skip

Anyone who has not been signed into the forum for at least this number of days will not receive their due check.
Leave at 0 to skip

setting.conf_title_desc: Lottery settings for the (e32) ibEconomy Application

setting.conf_description: Turn on the lottery component of ibEconomy?
Enter the rate at which each lottery will last. (in days)
Force a winner when the lottery ends?
If no winner, enable this setting to rollover the jackpot to the next lottery.
Before any tickets are purchased, how many points should be included in the winnings?
Enter the price for 1 lottery ticket
How many tickets can each user purchase for each lottery? (group permission overrides this)
Enter the number of balls used, the more you use the lower the chance of winning. Keep around 2 or 3 for most boards.

setting.conf_title: How Many Different Numbers to Choose From?
setting.conf_description: Enter the top number to pick from for each ball. Use smallish numbers, unless you sell A LOT of tickets. An example of odds: If you pick 3 balls above and 29 for this setting, that is already 3,654 different winning combinations. To google the odds search for: "29 choose 3" (replacing 29 and 3 with your settings).
If Yes, the below PM will be sent to the winner.
Input the account ID of the member who the PM will come from, if this ID is also the recipient, it will default to the ShopItem PM Sender (see the Shop Settings).
Enter the title of the lotto winner PM. The same macros below also work here.
setting.conf_default: You have won the lottery, worth <#AMOUNT#> Points!

setting.conf_description:
Enter the contents of the lotto winner PM. Replaceable Macros:
<#NAME#> - Name of winner <#AMOUNT#> - Amount of Lottery Winnings
setting.conf_default:
<#NAME#>,

You've won the lottery!

Enjoy the <#AMOUNT#> points!

-Administration
